item.title: Stuart Whitman Dies, Oscar-Nominated Actor Was 92
item.description: Stuart Whitman, who appeared in dozens of movies and television shows for decades, has passed away at the age of 92.

item.title: Kevin Smith Is Working on Mallrats 2 and Clerks 3 Scripts While in Self-Isolation
item.description: Kevin Smith says he'll be using his free time in self-isolation to finish the screenplays to two planned upcoming sequels.

item.title: Harley Quinn: Birds of Prey Digital Trailer Brings the Madness Home Early on VOD
item.description: Warner Bros. is starting the promotional campaign for Birds of Prey again in an effort to alert the public that it will be out digitally soon.

item.title: Disney Parks Are Losing $20 to $30 Million Per Day During Shutdown
item.description: With Disneyland and Walt Disney World closed due to the coronavirus pandemic is costing Disney millions in revenue.

item.title: A New Hope DeepFake Video Stars Ewan McGregor as Obi-Wan Kenobi
item.description: Ewan McGregor stars in the latest Star Wars DeepFake video, which will have fans wanting the Obi-Wan Kenobi series even more.

item.title: Rey Is All the Jedi as the Knights Return in New The Rise of Skywalker Digital Trailer
item.description: Disney put The Rise of Skywalker out a few days early on digital platforms, giving Star Wars fans something to do at home.

item.title: New on Disney+ April 2020: The Latest Movies and TV Shows
item.description: With everyone in self-quarantine for the foreseeable future, Disney Plus is rolling out a ton of new content for April 2020.

item.title: The Movie Business Is Going to Change Forever
item.description: With Universal making new movies available to rent from home, coupled with the financial hit the industry has suffered, the movie business will never be the same.

item.title: Michael Myers Actor Breathes Life Into Halloween Kills as He Quarantines in the Studio
item.description: Nick Castle bravely left his bunker to go work on Halloween Kills, which wrapped principal photography back in November.

item.title: Dolly Dearest Comes to Blu-ray for the First Time Ever from Vinegar Syndrome
item.description: Bonkers straight-to-video 90s horror movie Dolly Dearest is getting a legit release from Vinegar Syndrome.

item.title: Mission: Impossible 7 Stunt Rig Test Photos Leak, But Tom Cruise Isn't Filming Yet
item.description: Production on Mission: Impossible 7 hasn't resumed yet, but Tom Cruise was seen in new set photos with the crew practicing a stunt rig.

item.title: Tales from The Darkside: The Movie Is Getting a Collector's Edition Blu-ray This Summer
item.description: 90s horror anthology Tales from The Darkside: The Movie is getting a fantastic new definitive release from Shout! Factory this summer.

item.title: Linda Hamilton Knew Terminator: Dark Fate Would Upset Fans with Its Opening Scene
item.description: Terminator: Dark Fate was not the box office hit that the studio was hoping for and the story isn't exactly what fans were hoping for either.

item.title: Netflix Party Brings Movie Night to Social Distancing, Here's How to Watch with Friends
item.description: As most of the world prepares for quarantine, a new Google Chrome extension makes it easier to enjoy time with friends online.

item.title: Cats Fans Demand a Cut of the Movie You Won't Believe Exists
item.description: Cats began trending on Twitter again but for perhaps the most unexpected reason, even for a movie like this.

item.title: BossLogic's Spider-Man 3 Posters Bring Daredevil and Deadpool Into the Mix
item.description: BossLogic has made an interesting poster for Spider-Man 3 that adds Daredevil and Deadpool into the MCU.

item.title: Will More Delayed Movies Be Heading to Digital Instead of Theaters?
item.description: The National Association of Theatre Owners expects movies like Black Widow and F9 to play in theaters following recent delays.

item.title: Johnny Depp Is Perfect for Joker in The Batman Says Kevin Smith
item.description: The filmmaker and comic book aficionado chimes in on Johnny Depp potentially taking on the role of the Joker.

item.title: The Last Jedi Director Wishes Test Screenings Had Been an Option
item.description: Director Rian Johnson wishes he had been able to have a test screening for his polarizing addition to the Star Wars franchise.

item.title: Black Widow Delay Won't Shake-Up the Marvel Phase 4 Timeline Much
item.description: Despite the delay of Black Widow, a Marvel source has assured fans that Phase 4 will still play out as planned.

item.title: Get Out Becomes Stay In with BossLogic's Shelter-In-Place Parody Poster
item.description: This humorous piece of artwork turns Jordan Peele's horror flick into a satirical look at the times we're living in.

item.title: New Saw Movie Spiral & Antebellum Have Been Delayed Indefinitely
item.description: Several much-anticipated horror movies have now been added to the growing list of movies being delayed due to COVID-19.

item.title: Why Black Adam? The Rock Answers DC Fan Questions in New Video
item.description: Dwayne Johnson breaks down his thought process behind the new DC Comics adventure Black Adam.

item.title: Warner Bros. Is Moving Away from the DCEU According to Amy Adams
item.description: Amy Adams is hearing things through the grapevine about Warner Bros. future plans for the DCEU.

item.title: Shudder Offers Free 30-Day Trial to New Shut-Ins
item.description: Shudder is giving away 30 days of free horror content to new users with the coronavirus leaving people home for weeks.

item.title: Freddy Krueger Actor Robert Englund Teases an Appearance on a 'Terribly Popular' TV Show
item.description: Robert Englund says he's preparing for a new role on a 'terribly, terribly popular' television series, though he doesn't say which one.

item.title: The Lurker Trailer Brings a New Slasher to Digital This April
item.description: Scout Taylor-Compton will face off against a deadly slasher known as The Lurker this April on Digital and DVD.

item.title: James Gunn Is Torn Between Choosing His Favorite Joker, But It's Not Jared Leto
item.description: James Gunn just can't decide which Joker actor is his favorite, but it's between Heath Ledger and Joaquin Phoenix.

item.title: Cinemark Will Close All 345 U.S. Movie Theaters Starting Wednesday
item.description: Following in the footsteps of AMC and Regal, Cinemark is closing temporarily due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Failed Catwoman Audition Left Bloodshot Star Eiza Gonzalez Heartbroken
item.description: Eiza Gonzalez came very close to playing Selina Kyle in The Batman, only to be left 'heartbroken' when she wasn't cast.

item.title: Avatar Sequels Pause Filming in New Zealand
item.description: James Cameron's long-awaited Avatar 2 is putting filming on hold amidst the growing coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The Last Blockbuster Trailer Brings a Much-Needed Shot of Video Store Nostalgia
item.description: PopMotion Pictures has released a new trailer for The Last Blockbuster, which looks at the last Blockbuster Video location in the world.

item.title: Alamo Drafthouse Shuts Down Movie Theater Locations Nationwide
item.description: Due to the coronavirus outbreak, the Alamo Drafthouse is closing all but one of its locations across the U.S.

item.title: Spider-Man 3 May Bring Back Charlie Cox as Daredevil Teases Kevin Smith
item.description: With Spider-Man 3 set to arrive next year, and Peter Parker in need of a lawyer, a certain character may be making his way to the MCU.

item.title: Uncharted Movie Production Shuts Down Just as It Was Finally Ready to Shoot
item.description: The upcoming Uncharted adaptation has been delayed indefinitely amid coronavirus concerns.

item.title: Harley Quinn: Birds of Prey and The Gentlemen Get Early VOD Releases
item.description: A couple of major movies still playing in theaters will hit VOD early, including Margot Robbie's Birds of Prey.

item.title: David Harbour Tackles 'Black Widow' Meets 'Stranger Things' Fan Theory
item.description: Black Widow star David Harbour discusses the fan theory that his character from the Marvel movie and Stranger Things are the same guy.

item.title: Even Michael Caine Doesn't Know What Christopher Nolan's Tenet Is About
item.description: Actor Michael Caine has been discussing the upcoming thriller Tenet and has revealed exactly what he knows about the secretive movie.

item.title: Black Widow Gets Delayed Indefinitely
item.description: Due to concerns over the coronavirus, Disney has delayed the release of Black Widow, as well as several other titles.

item.title: Movie Theaters Across the U.K. & Ireland Close Down
item.description: Cinemas across the UK and Ireland have decided to close their doors for the foreseeable future in the wake of coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Devon Sawa Is Living His Final Destination Fate as He Celebrates Movie's 20th Anniversary
item.description: Final Destination was released in theaters 20 years ago today and star Devon Sawa took a moment to topically remember one of the most memorable scenes.

item.title: Mortal Kombat Star Quotes Ernest Hemingway While Talking Jax and Monster Hunting
item.description: Mehcad Brooks discusses his approach to Jax in the upcoming Mortal Kombat Reboot produced by James Wan.

item.title: AMC Theatres Will Shut Down for Up to 3 Months
item.description: Following suit of other major U.S. movie theater chains, AMC will be closing theaters for at least six to twelve weeks due to the coronavirus, though they could stay closed longer.

item.title: Tom Cruise Says There Will Never Be Another Film Like Top Gun: Maverick
item.description: Tom Cruise talks about scenes in Top Gun 2 that have never been pulled off cinematically before.

item.title: Thirteen Ghosts Is Getting a Definitive Blu-ray Release from Scream Factory
item.description: Shout! Factory is unleashing a brand new definitive edition of 2001's Thirteen Ghosts remake with loads of cool extras.

item.title: Hugh Jackman Reacts to Kumail Nanjiani's Wolverine Transformation
item.description: Kumail Nanjiani took part in recent photoshoot where he portrayed a number of macho movie characters from over the years.

item.title: 2020 Razzie Awards Winners Announced and Cats Almost Sweeps It All
item.description: The Razzies was set to hold their annual event over the weekend, but had to cancel due to the coronavirus.

item.title: Will Apple Buy Disney Following the Stock Market Crash?
item.description: Analyst Bernie McTernan thinks Apple buying Disney makes a lot of sense, and it could be closer to reality than it seems.

item.title: The Suicide Squad Stands as Its Own Thing in the DC Movie Universe Says James Gunn
item.description: James Gunn's The Suicide Squad will have a separate tone from the rest of the projects DC and Warner Bros. have put out.

item.title: Picard Showrunner Is Holding Out for an Adam Warlock Call from Marvel
item.description: Michael Chabon wants to be the one to finally bring Adam Warlock to the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
